ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: For people who are interested in history, myth and symbols, this is a great class to understand how that influences the current environmental movement.
The class is as valuable as you make it. This was the only course where I questioned the meaning of existence and my personal life motivations on a regular basis.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Access to and interpretation of Yale's treasures; interacting with unique artifacts; having time to engage with some incredible rare and intriguing pieces of history.

It was great to get out of the classroom and get see/learn about the different collections at Yale - the Babylonian Collection, the Ripley alchemical scrolls, Voynich Manuscript (to name a few) - all were amazing to to see up-close. The non-classroom format itself is great, very different compared to a lot of other Yale classes. Prof. Draghi was also fascinating to listen to, and lots of interesting topics were discussed over the course of the class!
Unusual for FES students, culturally and artistically engaging and enlightening.
I enjoyed all the field trips.
Site visits! And Paul Draghi's an encyclopaedia of knowledge!
Art, finally.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Adding a walking tour of campus would be great; all that time in the library and museums is great, but having a better appreciation for subjects that the entire public can enjoy and that students can share would be nice.

It might be nice if at certain points in the semester there were more formalized discussions/debate of the different ideas and themes that had come up. Not sure how this would be done logistically with the field trips etc, but it might be interesting for getting to know people in the class a bit better, as well as for having a more formalized discussion at times.
It would be great if the instructor followed the syllabus and the readings for the day.
Organization of topics to ensure less repetition and less derailing
Tunnels.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course provides a nice complement to the more technical courses offered at FES. It is about myth and story and uses examples from antiquity to describe challenges that humans have faced with nature and the environment in ways that are timeless and relatable.
I was interested in a discussion of nature that went beyond the mainstream perspectives. As an art and history enthusiast, this was a great way to look at nature from a different perspective.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I enjoy art history so this was a great way for me to understand nature from that perspective
Interest in the arts and the environment

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: It did - but I do suggest that for next time, the instructor include how colonialism has shaped much of what is seen as art and culture. This is an important discussion to have as well.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take this class to balance an otherwise heavy workload, as the amount of work needed outside of class is limited. Come with an open mind and an appreciation of history, and be prepared to be fascinated by the amount of access and engagement Prof. Draghi provides the students.

I'd tell them to take it, extremely enjoyable course and they'll learn a lot. There definitely is a continual theme in the class, although the topics range so broadly that they should probably expect to come out knowing a little about a lot of (fascinating) topics, rather than understanding one topic in-depth.
I would suggest them to be open to the fact that much of the quality of the class depends on the quality of the students and to be okay with a fluid class structure.
I really liked it :)
A good balancing point. Challenge self to find the meaning in it.
